AC Milan have the idea of making a move for Bologna midfielder Mattias Svanberg, a report claims, but not until the summer.

Gianluca Di Marzio (via MilanNews) told Sky on Monday night that Milan have already taken concrete steps to lay the foundation for a potential negotiation. Ricky Massara has spoken with Bologna director Walter Sabatini, as well as the Swede’s agent Martin Dahlin, and the idea would be to sign him at the end of the season.

According to il Corriere dello Sport (via MilanNews), the management are indeed looking to the future and the paper explains how the Rossoneri are interested in Svanberg.

The 21-year-old is currently valued at around €15million but a real negotiation has not yet started because, as mentioned, the operation is one that Paolo Maldini and co. have in mind for the summer window rather than the immediate.

Svanberg’s name was also recommended to the Rossoneri management by compatriot Zlatan Ibrahimovic, the source adds.
